author: parithosh
content: Can one of you attending the BALs breakout rooms please make sure to be at ACDT the week after and give us a testing update so we know how things are going?

author: nero_eth
content:
Specs are in sync with the EIP, including the latest changes:
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/pull/1338

author: jwasinger
content:
I have some initial performance numbers from Geth for an import of 10,000 recent blocks. 

**TLDR**:  with the current BAL changes there is a 34% reduction in average block processing time, 80% reduction in transaction execution time.

 Benchmark machine has a xeon 6548N processor with 16 cores, 32gb of ram, mounted SSD capped at 9000 iops.

author: jwasinger
content: 1.  Block processing time

author: jwasinger
content: * Geth master branch

author: jwasinger
content: * BAL branch

author: jwasinger
content: 2. breakdown of the individual components of block processing

author: jwasinger
content:
* Geth master branch.

tx execution time is `execution`+`storage read`+`account read`.  total trie hashing time is `account update + storage update` (this doesn't include the time to fetch trie nodes from disk which is performed concurrently with tx execution)

author: jwasinger
content: * BAL branch.  `block execution` is total time for parallel transaction execution.  `state-root calculation` is the time needed to fetch trie nodes and perform hashing.

author: jwasinger
content: I am working on an optimization to the BAL branch which will likely remove most of the overhead from the category named "block preprocessing" in the above image.
